name: Rolled off by dice
description:
Rolled off by dice

a simple boardgame but with a twist: Everyone plays at the same time and has to get all of their 4 pieces into the goal. Everytime you throw a piece of someone else over with your dice, they get set back the rolled amount of fields (you also move set amout forward with a piece of your joice.)

Whenever you land on the same spot as another piece, that piece gets put back in starting position.

Have fun!

Controlls

you play black

select your pieces with numbers 1-4, throw and accept with spacebar

Credits

Gamedesign, Programming, Art: Niclas3006, Jongs, Maik

Cover Image: Hiccup

Tipps and Tricks

you can try blocking the dices by throwing your own against them or throw it only a little bit forward to use it as a shield. Try to keep your distance from the enemies, so they don't land on your spot and send you back. You can't jump over your own pieces in the goal, so always push them forward if you can.  If your selected piece can't go in (it has to land perfectly) it will do nothing. Don't send the enemy pieces from their start back in front of their goal.

Tools used

Unity, Blender, Audacity, Photoshop, paint.net, procreate
